intro: Salvia bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá sage, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant produces vibrant violet to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Salvia bogotensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its medicinal properties.
